intro: Rhodiola biternata, commonly known as the alpine rose or tibetan rhodiola, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant thrives in cold, high-altitude environments and is adapted to harsh climatic conditions. It is often found in rocky soils and alpine meadows, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity. Rhodiola biternata is also valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional medicine for its purported adaptogenic and anti-fatigue effects.
